data.name: Checking if Molecule String has balanced braces
data.description:
This is part of the solution you can use to solve  [Molecule to atoms Kata](https://www.codewars.com/kata/molecule-to-atoms/javascript). One needs to check if the given String is valid. The examples are taken from the Molecule to atoms kata. A String is valid if it:
- contains one valid element. An element is valid if it has the Form UpperCase Letter and optional lower case letter (Mg or O for instance)
- the bracket { [ ( ) ] } are well balanced. That means, if one bracket was opened, it has to be closed afterwards. It is not allowed, that a bracket of another type closes the another bracket. For example: this is not valid [(] or {[)}.

For example:
```
String water = "H2O";
checkIfMoleculeNotationIsValid(water); // true

String magnesiumHydroxide = "Mg(OH)2";
checkIfMoleculeNotationIsValid(magnesiumHydroxide); // true

String fremySalt = "K4[ON(SO3)2]2";
checkIfMoleculeNotationIsValid(fremySalt); // true

String someMolecule = "K4{O2N34[Mg3O3)]}";
checkIfMoleculeNotationIsValid(someMolecule); // false
```

Note that brackets may be round, square or curly and can also be nested. Index after the braces is optional.
